reviewText: Did not show band members like episodes that were shot in Nashville. These were taken in New York, maybe. Also too much Faron Young.
Enjoy playing these for my husband.  He doesn't like the current country music.  He relates more to the old timers since he is getting to be an old timer too.

Season 4 is the final 13 episodes (40-52) of Country Style U.S.A.. Unlike previous seasons that had a host and a main guest artist, Faron Young acts as both host and main guest artist in every episode. If you're not a fan of him, you will probably be very disappointed with this season. He is present throughout most of it with few exceptions. Worse is that most of the second/special guest artists are forgettable or uninspired. However, Patsy Cline does "Walkin' After Midnight", so there may be an incentive to go ahead and get this to complete your Country Style U.S.A. library.

Faron Young performs:

A World So Full of Love
All Right
Alone with You
Bouquet of Roses
Chattanooga Shoe Shine Boy
Country Girl (with Darrell McCall)
Face to the Wall (with Darrell McCall)
Forget the Past (with Darrell McCall)
Goin' Steady
Hey Good Lookin' (with The Jordanaires)
I Hear You Talkin'
I Miss You Already (And You're Not Even Gone)
If You Ain't Lovin' (You Ain't Livin')
I'll Be Alright (In the Morning) (with The Jordanaires)
I'm Gonna Live Some Before I Die
Is She All You Thought She'd Be
I've Got Five Dollars and It's Saturday Night
Live Fast, Love Hard, Die Young
Making Believe
Riverboat (with The Jordanaires)
The Shrine of St. Cecilia (with The Jordanaires)
Sweet Dreams
Tennessee Waltz
That's the Way I Feel
That's the Way It's Gotta Be
There's Not Any Like You Left (with Darrell McCall)
When I've Learned Enough to Live I'll Be Old Enough to Die
Your Old Used to Be (with Darrell McCall)
You're Still Mine

The guests:

Billy Grammer - Gotta Travel On (with The Jordanaires)
Billy Walker - Changed My Mind
Bobby Sykes - Having Myself a Ball (with The Jordanaires)
Buck Owens - Above and Beyond (with Darrell McCall)
Hank Garland - Sugarfoot Rag
Jimmy Newman - Wanting You with Me Tonight
Joan Hager - Why Do I Love You, Darling (with The Jordanaires)
Johnny Seay - Streets of Laredo
The Jordanaires - Down by the Riverside
The Jordanaires - One of These Mornings
Patsy Cline - Walkin' After Midnight
Roy Drusky - Anymore (with The Jordanaires)
Skeeter Davis - Am I That Easy to Forget

For me, the Billy Walker, Buck Owens and Patsy Cline performances save this from being forgettable.

I really like these old shows. The video and sound quality are both good. The problem that I have with this dvd is that Faron Young hosts all 13 programs and except for Patsy Cline, Skeeter Davis and a young Buck Owens, the guests  on the other shows are not that well known.
